channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump admits the GOP was blindsided by economy fears as Democrats sweep key races: ‘Republicans don’t talk about the word affordability’
item.description: "We have the greatest economy right now. A lot of people don’t see that," Trump said.

item.title: If Arctic Frost Perpetrators Don’t Go To Jail, Conservatives Will
item.description: To conservatives, Arctic Frost is a scandal. To Democrats, it’s their new baseline. And the only way to stop it is to punish them.

item.title: Dems Try To Sabotage Push For Proof Of Citizenship To Vote
item.description: Leftist Groups Flood the EAC with comments in an effort to kill a call for documentary proof of U.S. citizenship to vote in U.S. elections.

item.title: Pro-Israel House Dem draws leftist primary challenge
item.description: Michael Blake, a former New York state lawmaker, has launched a bid to challenge incumbent Democratic Rep. Ritchie Torres in the U.S. House.

item.title: Democrats brace for midterm civil war as 'old guard' leaders put on notice
item.description: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani's stunning win in New York's mayoral race blew up the internal fight that threatens to break apart the Democratic ...

item.title: The ‘bike bus’ movement has taken over one New Jersey town, with hundreds biking to school each day: ‘People naturally gravitate to something that’s super joyful’
item.description: What began as a handful of parents hoping to encourage their kids to bike to school has grown into a weekly ritual for the township.

item.title: Coast Guard’s record-breaking cocaine haul in 2025 could have poisoned half the US
item.description: The Coast Guard breaks all-time record with 510,000 pounds of cocaine seized in fiscal year 2025, three times the annual average and equivalent to 193...

item.title: Tuesday's election wins embolden Democrats in shutdown fight over affordable health care
item.description: Senate Democrats are seizing on their party's widespread victories in Tuesday's elections as reason to continue their shutdown fight over health care ...

item.title: The Nationalization of Elections Is Anti-American
item.description: Our Founding Fathers fought for our right not to care about who New Jersey elects as governor.

item.title: Russia drawing up plans to conduct nuclear tests after Trump announcement
item.description: Putin orders nuclear test preparations after Trump announces U.S. will resume testing. Russia vows proportionate response to American nuclear program ...

item.title: Anxious generation author warns Gen z’s brains are ‘growing around their phones’ the way a tree warps around a tombstone
item.description: Speaking at a Dartmouth symposium on mental health, NYU professor Jonathan Haidt discussed his research on “the Great Rewiring.”

item.title: The New York Times Is Terrified Of Mamdani, The Mayor It Helped Create
item.description: The New York Times helped create Zohran Mamdani, and now the paper is worried that he will do everything he says.

item.title: For Gen Z, it’s ‘not enough to work hard’ if you want to succeed, says Jamie Dimon—specific skills are the way to get ahead

item.title: The pope hates it. Norway hates it. Elon Musk calls them ‘corporate terrorists.’ Welcome to Tesla’s trillion-dollar showdown
item.description: “He frequently teeters on the edge of disaster," said Tesla owner and money manager Nancy Tengler, "and then pulls back just in the nick of time.”

item.title: Leftist Radicals In Office Are Much More Dangerous Than Fringe Radicals On Podcasts
item.description: The radicals Democrats label 'right-wing' are on podcasts. The left-wing radicals are in office.

item.title: Senate hearing gets heated over shutdown after 'stalking' accusation flies

item.title: New York Times Coverage Avoids the Third Rails of Sex Trafficking
item.description: We must not ignore the role of illegal immigration and abortion.

item.title: Federal judge says ICE detainees 'shouldn't be sleeping next to overflowing toilets' at Chicago-area facility
item.description: Federal Judge Robert Gettleman ordered an ICE facility near Chicago to improve living conditions for detainees, requiring clean bedding and hygiene.

item.title: Supreme Court Signals Skepticism About Trump’s ‘Emergency’ Tariffs
item.description: '[T]hese are not things that are thought of as Article II powers, [but] quintessential Article I powers,' said Justice Kagan.

item.title: It Is Time to Be Done with Shutdowns
item.description: We’re five weeks into a government shutdown. It should be the last one.

item.title: A Visit to Sarasota’s Ringling Museum
item.description: It’s both whimsical and serious, though its website is awful. And, Governor DeSantis, don’t mess with its governance.
